page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: Kirkcaldy Street names are derived from various sources. 1{Church Streets.} Abbotshall Road. The Abbot of Dunfermline built his house here to enjoy the sea breezes and relax away from his Abbey. 2{Geographical Streets.} Dunearn Drive. Dunearn Hill is situated to the west of Kirkcaldy. 3{Industrial Streets.} Coal Wynd. Coal came from the Lina Pit at Johnny Marshall's Loan and was brought down through the town to the harbour via Coal Wynd. 4{Manorial Streets.} Oriel Road. This Street was named after Oriel, the 1st son of Vicount and Vicountess Ferrard.
